definition: second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
nanosecond, ns, 10^-9 s (PRC)/Taiwan equivalent: 奈秒[nai4 miao3]
nanosecond, ns, 10^-9 s (Tw)/PRC equivalent: 納秒|纳秒[na4 miao3]
(Internet) flash sale/(sports or online gaming) rapid dispatch of an opponent

sentences.english: A nanosecond is one-billionth of a second.
The prototypes they have now let you fly a whole 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 現在研究出來的原型機只能讓你飛整整的30秒。

sentences.english: Enemies hit by meteors are knocked down, 25 second recharge.
sentences.chinese: 被隕石雨擊中的敵人將倒地，25秒回覆。

sentences.english: Skeletal Mastery research time reduced to 30 seconds from 45 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 精通招喚骷髏的研發時間從45秒縮減爲30秒。

sentences.english: Skeletal Mastery research time reduced to 30 seconds from 45 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 精通招喚骷髏的研發時間從45秒縮減爲30秒。

sentences.english: A Stitch in Time Saves Nine Billion.
sentences.chinese: 及時一秒勝過事後九億秒。

sentences.english: Paralyzing Touch I - Counterattack that stuns your opponent for 15 seconds or until they are hit.
sentences.chinese: 打暈目標15秒，只能在一次成功閃避後使用。

sentences.english: The skip bombs were fused at fifteen seconds there was no room for error.
sentences.chinese: 跳彈的引信只有15秒，沒有任何出錯的餘地。

sentences.english: I guess the whole batch is running under 15 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 我推測整組都是在15秒內跑完的。

sentences.english: Do not let her to spend these 15 seconds just dully waiting for you.
sentences.chinese: 所以，不要讓她把這15秒花在無聊地等待中。

sentences.english: Paal claims that tool-changeover is completed within 20 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 包道格稱，工具，轉換完成20秒內。

sentences.english: Winning his heat in a comfortable 14.02 seconds in front of 3500 people at Tseung Kwan O Sports Ground, Liu Xiang finally strode home with 13.66 seconds for the title.
sentences.chinese: 而在此前的預賽中，劉翔以14秒02輕鬆晉級。

sentences.english: Adopt 555 in fixed time the machine is second pulser of main parts.
sentences.chinese: 採用555定時器爲主要部件的秒脈衝發生器。

sentences.english: The right song can change your outlook on life in under 45 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 合適的歌曲可以在45秒之內改變你對生活的看法。

sentences.english: Use your knuckles to briskly rub the Hoku point for thirty seconds.
sentences.chinese: 用你的指關節要輕快揉合谷穴30秒的點。

sentences.english: Then you walk for 90 seconds again. And so on.

definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
to do sth by mistake (with one's hand)/to make a slip of the hand (e.g. click the wrong button)
to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
(Internet) flash sale/(sports or online gaming) rapid dispatch of an opponent
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
